title: Where is the best place to find blogs to guest post on? - Quora

response.answer_text: As someone else said, a good place to start is with the blogs you already know and love. Plus, you’re already familiar with their writing style and their content. First thing to do is to check to see whether they have a guest blogging guidelines/write for us page; if they don’t, look at their contact page, as some blogs will mention on there whether they accept guest posts or not. If you find such information on their blog, then that’s great; if you don’t find anything related to guest blogging, don’t worry, you can still pitch your ideas. Ideally, try to engage on their blog for a bit by sharing their content on social media and by leaving thoughtful comments on their blog posts. Finally, if they have any guidelines, use them for when you write your pitch to them, and if they don’t, simply: · talk about the fact that you are a fan of their blog · explain why you’d be a good choice for a guest post · give them links to some good blog posts you’ve written in the past · and don’t forget to also pitch them your guest post idea – or, it might be better to give them more ideas, just so they have a better choice. Once you’re done pitching your favourite blogs, there are plenty of lists online with websites that accept guest posts, like my list of quality blogs that accept guest posts. There are over 400 blogs in there and they are split into 20 different categories, like for e.g., marketing, technology, web design, finance, books and writing, health and fitness and more. Apart from that, you can also use Google to search for guest blogging opportunities. Simply search for: · “blog topic” + blog + guest blog · “blog topic” + blog + write for us · “blog topic” + blog + guest blog guidelines · “blog topic” + blog + submit a story To give you an example, when searching for travel blogs, search for: “traveling blog write for us/guest blog guidelines”. It’s easy and quick – but, make sure that the blog is active and that the quality of their content is good enough. Hope that helps!

Usually you can go about asking content oriented websites if they are looking forward to hiring guest bloggers. Or you can simply freelance through websites like Get Everything You Need Starting at $5 - Fiverr , Hire Freelancers & Find Freelance Jobs Online , Articles & Blogs Writers - Contentmart  Websites like Storypick , BuzzFeed, ScoopWhoop, etc are always on the look out for creative minds (Writers with a creative knack)  http://Huffpost.in is another website where after an application you could be hired to write posts for them. The internet is huge, research to make the most of it :)
